title: From beaches to peaks, France is suffering effects of climate crisis
summary: The Climate Action Network has listed the current and foreseeable impacts of global warming in France, region by region, in a summary intended as a decision-making tool.

title: Harris and Oprah 'Unite for America' to discuss the presidential candidate's plans to help a deflated, yet hopeful nation
summary: With stars like Meryl Streep and Julia Roberts joining in virtually, the Vice President sat down with host Oprah Winfrey for a special livestream in the battleground state of Michigan on Thursday.

title: French PM Barnier presents cabinet to Macron
summary: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier arrived at the Elysée on Thursday evening to propose his new government to President Emmanuel Macron.

title: French mass rape trial: 'Something was wrong', one of 50 defendants tells court
summary: The defendant, Lionel R., involved in the mass rape trial said he recognized he did not 'obtain' Gisèle Pelicot's 'consent' after being invited by Dominique Pelicot, Gisèle Pelicot's then-husband, to their home.

title: Pager explosions in Lebanon: Hezbollah is trapped in its support for Hamas
summary: Weakened by the pager attacks, the Shiite party now bears the responsibility of deciding whether or not to engage in a decisive escalation against Israel.

title: As wildfires rage in Portugal, so do debates about their origins
summary: Some 40 fires are still active and at least seven people have died in the Aveiro region since Sunday. After the deadly fires of 2017, the country thought it had taken steps to avoid such disasters. Forest management has come under particular scrutiny.

title: Wildberries, Russia's version of tech giant Amazon, at the center of a deadly family and business feud
summary: The contentious divorce between Tatyana Bakalchuk – Russia's richest woman and founder of the e-commerce site – and her husband turned into a shootout on Wednesday, resulting in the deaths of two security guards. The husband, who demanded 50% of the capital, was arrested and charged with murder.

title: In the UK, the Starmer couple's fondness for gifts is causing controversy
summary: Accommodation expenses, clothing, tickets to Taylor Swift concerts and football matches ... In five years, the Labour leader is said to have accepted gifts worth a record £100,000.

title: Strike at Boeing: CEO threatens employees with unpaid furloughs
summary: On the sixth day of the labor dispute paralyzing part of the American aircraft manufacturer's production, CEO Kelly Ortberg announced that tens of thousands of employees would soon be furloughed.

title: Mexican president partially blames US for bloody cartel eruption in Sinaloa
summary: López Obrador said the United States bore some of the responsibility 'for having carried out that operation' to arrest Ismael 'El Mayo' Zambada.

title: Lebanon outraged by unprecedented attack against Hezbollah
summary: Any criticism of the Shiite movement inside the country has been temporarily muted.

title: Air France, Lufthansa extend suspension of flights to Tel Aviv, Tehran and Beirut
summary: France's main carrier Air France said it was extending its suspension of flights to Tel Aviv and Beirut until end-Friday, after 37 people were killed and thousands injured when hundreds of pagers and walkie-talkies exploded in Lebanon on Tuesday and Wednesday.

title: French billionaire Xavier Niel plays rock star in Paris
summary: On Wednesday, the founder of French telecom company Free gave advice on how to get rich at an event served to promote the release of his new book.

title: EU chief announces billions for countries hit by 'heartbreaking' floods
summary: Speaking from the Polish city of Wroclaw, EU Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen announced member nations would receive €10 billion ($11 billion) to help overcome last week's devastating floods.

title: Zelensky to meet Biden, Harris on visit to US next week
summary: The Ukrainian president also said he plans to meet with Donald Trump, before the US' November elections that could see support for Ukraine upended.

title: Ukraine destroys huge Russian ammunition depot
summary: A night-time air attack by the Ukrainian army using new cruise missiles resulted in the destruction of a large warehouse filled with Russian long-range weapons.

title: Diamonds are Botswana's best friend but they aren't forever
summary: Gemstone sales account for a quarter of the country's GDP, but falling global prices are forcing it to diversify its economy.

title: Le Monde's festival celebrates the paper's 80th anniversary with debates, concerts and more
summary: Le Monde is celebrating its 80th anniversary (and the 10th anniversary of the Le Monde festival!) from September 19 to 22, 2024.

title: French mass rape trial 'shows the extent to which sexual violence is integrated in our society'
summary: A set of myths exist about rape, rapists and victims which prevents us from considering the diversity of situations of sexual violence, writer Noémie Renard told Le Monde.

title: Surge in online sports betting is ruining thousands of Brazilians
summary: In the absence of regulation, gaming platforms are heavily promoting their services on social media using local celebrities, such as football player Neymar.

title: Trump vows to be 'best friend' to Jewish Americans, as allegations of ally's antisemitism surface
summary: 'My promise to Jewish Americans is this: With your vote, I will be your defender, your protector, and I will be the best friend Jewish Americans have ever had in the White House," Trump said to a group of Jewish donors at an event Thursday in Washington.

title: European Heritage Days: 10 ideas for seaside visits
summary: The culture section of 'Le Monde' offers a selection of sites highlighting maritime heritage. The 41st edition of the event takes place on September 21 and 22.

title: Greater Paris transport prices to be fairer, more expensive for Parisians
summary: From January 2, 2025, all journeys by metro, RER and train, purchased individually, will cost €2.50, regardless of distance. This one-price ticket will put an end to the region's complex fare structure.
